snippet: The proposal marks the first time the Environmental Protection Agency has taken steps to slow down the drive to replace fossil fuels with renewable forms of energy.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency proposes reducing amount of ethanol that is required to be mixed with the gasoline supply, first time it has taken steps to slow down drive to replace fossil fuels with renewable forms of energy; move draws bitter complaints from advocates of ethanol, including some environmentalists, who see the corn-based fuel blend as weapon to fight climate change.
lead_paragraph: The proposal marks the first time the Environmental Protection Agency has taken steps to slow down the drive to replace fossil fuels with renewable forms of energy.

headline.main: For First Time, E.P.A. Proposes Reducing Ethanol Requirement for Gas Mix
headline.print_headline: For First Time, E.P.A. Proposes Reducing Ethanol Requirement for Gas Mix
